problem_text:
Let F and H be local formations of finite groups and suppose that F is not contained in H. Does F necessarily have at least one minimal local non-H-subformation?
A. N. Skiba, L. A. Shemetkov
answer: No, not necessarily (V. P. Burichenko, Trudy Inst. Math. National Akad. Sci. Belarus’, 21, no. 1 (2013), 15–24 (Russian)).
